page.title: 18POLICE DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: The last resident P.C.was withdrawn in 1970.for the next 10 years the region was serviced by mobile patrols from Torpoint and Looe.In 1980 a Community Constable was designated to have special responsibility for the main area.This officer has backup assistance when necessary from mobile patrols and specialist departments e.g dog handlers,helicopters,school liason and crime officers(detectives). Although there are fewer foot patrols and there is less surveillance of the area than formerly ,the advent of radio contact with the control at Launceston means that any major incident ,day or night,will result in police attention within 20 minutes of the initial report.However the absence of 'the man in uniform' for long periods is seen as a difficulty in crime prevention.
